conclusion: Both objects start from the same location and move in the same direction with initial velocity \( v_0 \).
The graph shows the velocity of each object as a function of time.
The area under each curve represents the displacement of each object.
At \( t_1 \), object A has a higher velocity than object B.
At \( t_2 \), object A's velocity decreases to zero, while object B continues to move.
At \( t_3 \), object A's velocity increases again, while object B's velocity decreases.
At \( t_4 \), both objects have the same velocity.
The distance between the two objects is the difference in their displacements.
The maximum separation occurs when the difference in the areas under the curves is the greatest.
From \( t = 0 \) to \( t_1 \), object A is ahead of object B.
From \( t_1 \) to \( t_2 \), object B starts to catch up as object A slows down.
At \( t_2 \), object A momentarily stops, and object B continues moving, increasing the separation.
From \( t_2 \) to \( t_3 \), object A accelerates again, while object B decelerates, reducing the separation.
At \( t_3 \), the separation starts to decrease as object A catches up to object B.
The maximum separation occurs at \( t_2 \), where the difference in the areas under the curves is the greatest.
